bgp.name: BGP Route Table Dump
bgp.cmd4: birdc -r 'show route all for {{TARGET}} primary' 2> /dev/null | tail -n+3 | sed -r 's/BGP.next_hop: [0-9\.]+$/BGP.next_hop: 0.0.0.0/;s/BGP.next_hop: [a-f0-9:]+$/BGP.next_hop: ::/;s/ from [0-9\.]+\]/ from 0.0.0.0]/;s/ from [a-f0-9:]+\]/ from ::]/;s/unreachable \[/unicast [/'
bgp.cmd6: birdc6 -r 'show route all for {{TARGET}} primary' 2> /dev/null | tail -n+3 | sed -r 's/BGP.next_hop: [0-9\.]+$/BGP.next_hop: 0.0.0.0/;s/BGP.next_hop: [a-f0-9:]+$/BGP.next_hop: ::/;s/ from [0-9\.]+\]/ from 0.0.0.0]/;s/ from [a-f0-9:]+\]/ from ::]/;s/unreachable \[/unicast [/'

dnsr.name: DNS Resolver Test
dnsr.cmd4: rnd=$RANDOM; dig '@{{TARGET}}' +all +nsid A $(cat /proc/sys/kernel/random/uuid | cut -d- -f1).test.mtr.sh 2>&1; dig '@{{TARGET}}' +all +nsid AAAA $(cat /proc/sys/kernel/random/uuid | cut -d- -f1).test.mtr.sh 2>&1
dnsr.cmd6: rnd=$RANDOM; dig '@{{TARGET}}' +all +nsid A $(cat /proc/sys/kernel/random/uuid | cut -d- -f1).test.mtr.sh 2>&1; dig '@{{TARGET}}' +all +nsid AAAA $(cat /proc/sys/kernel/random/uuid | cut -d- -f1).test.mtr.sh 2>&1
